skill.name: router-stats
skill.description: Display Claude Router usage statistics and cost savings
skill.summary: Display Claude Router usage statistics and cost savings
skill.author: 0xrdan

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only reads a single JSON file containing router statistics. No network access, no command execution, no sensitive data access.

content.value_statement: Track your Claude Router usage and see estimated cost savings from intelligent model routing. Understand how queries are distributed across different model tiers.
actual_capabilities: Read and parse the router stats file at ~/.claude/router-stats.json
Display total queries routed across all model tiers (fast, standard, deep, orchestrated)
Calculate and visualize route distribution percentages with ASCII bar charts
Show tool-intensive and orchestrated query counts
Display exception handling statistics for router meta-queries
Calculate and display estimated cost savings compared to always using Opus
limitations: Only displays statistics when the router-stats.json file exists
Cannot track real-time data - only reads existing historical data
Savings estimates are based on assumed token usage (1K input + 2K output)

use_cases.title: Track Model Usage
use_cases.description: Monitor how Claude Router distributes your queries across different model tiers to optimize costs.

use_cases.title: Review Cost Savings
use_cases.description: See estimated monthly savings from using intelligent model routing instead of always using premium models.

use_cases.title: Analyze Query Patterns
use_cases.description: Understand your query distribution patterns and identify when different model tiers are most effective.

prompt_templates.title: View Current Stats
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me my current Claude Router statistics

prompt_templates.title: Check Savings
prompt_templates.prompt: How much have I saved using Claude Router this month?

prompt_templates.title: Route Breakdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the breakdown of which models Claude Router has been using for my queries

prompt_templates.title: Session History
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me my router usage history by session

output: Total Queries: 25 routed across fast, standard, deep, and orchestrated models
Route Distribution: Fast (32%), Standard (48%), Deep (8%), Orchestrated (12%)
Estimated Savings: $3.20 today, $15.00 total compared to always using Opus
Tool-intensive queries: 25 (handled appropriately based on complexity)

best_practices: Run periodically to track usage trends over time
Review route distribution to understand when different models are most effective
Use savings data to justify Claude Router adoption to stakeholders
anti_patterns: Do not use for real-time monitoring - data updates on session completion
Do not rely on savings as exact billing figures - estimates only
Do not expect data before using Claude Router for any queries

faq.question: Is Claude Router required for this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill only works when Claude Router is active and recording stats to the router-stats.json file.

faq.question: How accurate are the cost savings estimates?
faq.answer: Estimates use fixed token assumptions (1K input + 2K output) and current pricing. Actual costs vary based on actual token usage.

faq.question: Can I export my router statistics?
faq.answer: The skill reads the JSON file directly. You can export the file at ~/.claude/router-stats.json for external analysis.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only reads local statistics stored in your home directory. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why do router meta-queries show as exceptions?
faq.answer: Queries about the router itself are handled by Opus for accuracy while still recording what the classifier decided.

faq.question: How does this differ from native Claude metrics?
faq.answer: This focuses specifically on routing decisions and cost savings from model selection, complementing broader usage metrics.
